description: Demolition of garage; redevelopment to provide three storey residential building containing 5 flats fronting Culmington Road; 4 storey residential building containing 9 flats on land fronting Dane Road; parking, cycle storage, refuse, landscaping and alterations to vehicle access
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used in the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The Materials hall be implemented as approved.  The development shall be built only in accordance with the samples as approved.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B5, ES6 and H26; Replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5. | Details of the refuse storage and disposal arrangements shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before any part of the development is commenced. Such details as approved shall be implemented before first occupation of the development and thereafter retained.  Reason: To ensure satisfactory arrangements for refuse storage and disposal, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B5 & H34; Replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the phased programme agrees by the local planning authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.    Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B2, ES4 and H26; Replacement UDP policies 4.2, 4.5 and 5.5. | Details of access for people with disabilities shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before any work is commenced; and the approved scheme shall be implemented before the first occupation of residential accommodation, and shall be permanently retained.   Reason: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B6, ES3, H12; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected and this shall ensure visibility splays of 1.5m by 1.5m and that there are no obstructions to visibility above 0.6m high at either side of the vehicular access points. The details as approved shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and shall be permanently retained.   Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B5, B20, and ES2; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.4 and 5.5. | Details shall be submitted and approved by the local planning authority, before the development is commenced, of a visibility splay within the courtyard, where vehicles emerge into the courtyard, to deflect pedestrian movement away from the wall of unit 1 adjacent to where vehicles emerge. The details as approved shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and shall be permanently retained.   Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B5, B20, and T51; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.4, 5.5 and 9.1. | No development shall take place until a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The schedule shall include details of its arrangement for its implementation. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.  Reason: To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character of the area, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy ES4; Replacement UDP policy 4.5. | Prior to commencement of development, details of the design of the building and car/cycle parking area (including lighting) aiming to comply with the requirements of Secure By Design shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy B1, B20, H26 and H27; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.3, 4.4 and 5.5. | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan 308/014 rev A dated 26/09/03 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with the Council's adopted policy T51 and Replacement policy 9.1. | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, a contaminated land investigation shall be carried out, using sampling points and methods to be first agreed with the Council. If the survey shows a requirement for decontamination, a scheme of remedial works shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing and the scheme as approved shall be fully implemented before first occupation and permanently retained.   Reason: To protect health and safety, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies R5 and B1 and Replacement UDP policy 2.7 and 4.1. | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted for approval including the noise exposure category and/or BS4142 noise level and the noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation is to be provided. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter be permanently retained.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B5, ES5; Replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11. | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any development is commenced, to demonstrate that the layout and internal arrangement within the block of flats, maisonettes will be designed to ensure that:  + Similar types of rooms in flats, maisonettes are stacked above each other or adjoin each other. + Halls are used as buffer zones between sensitive rooms and staircases + Large family units are not situated above individual flats or bed-sits.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B5, ES5; Replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11. | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of works. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies H12 & H13; Replacement UDP policy 5.3. | No development shall take place until it has first been confirmed in writing to the local planning authority that the applicant/developer has permanent vehicular rights of way over the vehicle access off Dane Road, located to the north of the application site, such as to give continuous access to the car parking area within the application site indicated on drawing No 308/014 Rev.A.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with the Council's adopted policy T51 and Replacement policy 9.1. | Details of a layout for a children's play area for use by residents of the scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any works commence on site and the play area, as approved, shall be provided before any part of the development is first occupied. The play area shall be retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure satisfactory development and provision of  play facilities in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy H32; Replacement UDP policy 5.5.
